trans-unit.source: StorSimple system requirements | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: StorSimple system requirements | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes system requirements and best practices for software, high availability, and networking for an Azure StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: Describes system requirements and best practices for software, high availability, and networking for an Azure StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple software, high availability, and networking requirements
trans-unit.target: StorSimple software, high availability, and networking requirements

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Microsoft Azure StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Microsoft Azure StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: This article describes important system requirements and best practices for your StorSimple device and for the storage clients accessing the device.
trans-unit.target: This article describes important system requirements and best practices for your StorSimple device and for the storage clients accessing the device.

trans-unit.source: These requirements include:
trans-unit.target: These requirements include:

trans-unit.source: **Software requirements for storage clients** - describes the supported operating systems and any additional requirements for those operating systems.
trans-unit.target: **Software requirements for storage clients** - describes the supported operating systems and any additional requirements for those operating systems.

trans-unit.source: **High availability requirements for StorSimple** - describes high availability requirements and best practices for your StorSimple device and host computer.
trans-unit.target: **High availability requirements for StorSimple** - describes high availability requirements and best practices for your StorSimple device and host computer.

trans-unit.source: **Networking requirements for the StorSimple device** - provides information about the ports that need to be open in your firewall to allow for iSCSI, cloud, or management traffic.
trans-unit.target: **Networking requirements for the StorSimple device** - provides information about the ports that need to be open in your firewall to allow for iSCSI, cloud, or management traffic.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you review the following information carefully before you deploy your Azure StorSimple system, and then refer back to it as necessary during deployment and subsequent operation.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you review the following information carefully before you deploy your Azure StorSimple system, and then refer back to it as necessary during deployment and subsequent operation.

trans-unit.source: Software requirements for storage clients
trans-unit.target: Software requirements for storage clients

trans-unit.source: The following software requirements are for the storage clients that access your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: The following software requirements are for the storage clients that access your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Supported operating systems
trans-unit.target: Supported operating systems

trans-unit.source: Version required
trans-unit.target: Version required

trans-unit.source: Details/notes
trans-unit.target: Details/notes

trans-unit.source: Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Windows Server

trans-unit.source: StorSimple iSCSI volumes are supported for use on only the following Windows disk types:
trans-unit.target: StorSimple iSCSI volumes are supported for use on only the following Windows disk types:

trans-unit.source: Simple volume on basic disk
trans-unit.target: Simple volume on basic disk

trans-unit.source: Simple and mirrored volume on dynamic disk
trans-unit.target: Simple and mirrored volume on dynamic disk

trans-unit.source: Use of StorSimple Snapshot Manager on Windows Server is required for backup/restore of mirrored dynamic disks and for any application-consistent backups.
trans-unit.target: Use of StorSimple Snapshot Manager on Windows Server is required for backup/restore of mirrored dynamic disks and for any application-consistent backups.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Snapshot Manager is supported only on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (64-bit), Windows 2012 R2, and Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager is supported only on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (64-bit), Windows 2012 R2, and Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Window Server 2012, you must install .NET 3.5–4.5 before you install StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Window Server 2012, you must install .NET 3.5–4.5 before you install StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, you must install Windows Management Framework 3.0 before you install StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, you must install Windows Management Framework 3.0 before you install StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 thin provisioning and ODX features are supported if you are using a StorSimple iSCSI volume.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 thin provisioning and ODX features are supported if you are using a StorSimple iSCSI volume.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple can create thinly provisioned volumes only.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple can create thinly provisioned volumes only.

trans-unit.source: It cannot create fully provisioned or partially provisioned volumes.
trans-unit.target: It cannot create fully provisioned or partially provisioned volumes.

trans-unit.source: Reformatting a thinly provisioned volume may take a long time.
trans-unit.target: Reformatting a thinly provisioned volume may take a long time.

trans-unit.source: We recommend deleting the volume and then creating a new one instead of reformatting.
trans-unit.target: We recommend deleting the volume and then creating a new one instead of reformatting.

trans-unit.source: If you still prefer to reformat a volume:
trans-unit.target: If you still prefer to reformat a volume:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command before the reformat to avoid space reclamation delays:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command before the reformat to avoid space reclamation delays:

trans-unit.source: After the formatting is complete, use the following command to re-enable space reclamation:
trans-unit.target: After the formatting is complete, use the following command to re-enable space reclamation:

trans-unit.source: Apply the Windows Server 2012 hotfix as described in KB2870270 to your Windows Server computer.
trans-unit.target: Apply the Windows Server 2012 hotfix as described in KB2870270 to your Windows Server computer.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint is only supported on SharePoint 2010 and SharePoint 2013.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint is only supported on SharePoint 2010 and SharePoint 2013.

trans-unit.source: RBS requires SQL Server Enterprise Edition, version 2008 R2 or 2012.
trans-unit.target: RBS requires SQL Server Enterprise Edition, version 2008 R2 or 2012.

trans-unit.source: VMWare
trans-unit.target: VMWare

trans-unit.source: Tested with VMware vSphere 5.1 as iSCSI client
trans-unit.target: Tested with VMware vSphere 5.1 as iSCSI client

trans-unit.source: VAAI-block feature is tested with VMware vSphere v.5.1 on StorSimple devices.
trans-unit.target: VAAI-block feature is tested with VMware vSphere v.5.1 on StorSimple devices.

trans-unit.source: Linux RHEL/CentOS
trans-unit.target: Linux RHEL/CentOS

trans-unit.source: Support for Linux iSCSI clients with Open-iSCSI initiator versions 5 and 6
trans-unit.target: Support for Linux iSCSI clients with Open-iSCSI initiator versions 5 and 6

trans-unit.source: Supported with open-iSCSI initiator only.
trans-unit.target: Supported with open-iSCSI initiator only.

trans-unit.source: Linux
trans-unit.target: Linux

trans-unit.source: SUSE Linux 11
trans-unit.target: SUSE Linux 11

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Based on the limited testing performed in-house, IBM AIX is currently not supported with StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Based on the limited testing performed in-house, IBM AIX is currently not supported with StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: High availability requirements for StorSimple
trans-unit.target: High availability requirements for StorSimple

trans-unit.source: The hardware platform that is included with the StorSimple solution has enterprise-grade availability and reliability features that provide a foundation for a highly available, fault-tolerant storage infrastructure in your datacenter.
trans-unit.target: The hardware platform that is included with the StorSimple solution has enterprise-grade availability and reliability features that provide a foundation for a highly available, fault-tolerant storage infrastructure in your datacenter.

trans-unit.source: However, there are requirements and best practices that you should comply with to help ensure the availability of your Azure StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: However, there are requirements and best practices that you should comply with to help ensure the availability of your Azure StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy Azure StorSimple, carefully review the following requirements and best practices for the StorSimple device and connected host computers.
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy Azure StorSimple, carefully review the following requirements and best practices for the StorSimple device and connected host computers.

trans-unit.source: High availability requirements and procedures for your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: High availability requirements and procedures for your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Review the following information carefully to ensure the high availability of your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Review the following information carefully to ensure the high availability of your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Power and Cooling Modules (PCMs)
trans-unit.target: Power and Cooling Modules (PCMs)

trans-unit.source: StorSimple devices include redundant, hot-swappable PCMs.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple devices include redundant, hot-swappable PCMs.

trans-unit.source: Each PCM has enough capacity to provide service for the entire chassis.
trans-unit.target: Each PCM has enough capacity to provide service for the entire chassis.

trans-unit.source: To ensure high availability, both PCMs must be installed.
trans-unit.target: To ensure high availability, both PCMs must be installed.

trans-unit.source: Connect your PCMs to different power sources to provide availability if a power source fails.
trans-unit.target: Connect your PCMs to different power sources to provide availability if a power source fails.

trans-unit.source: If a PCM fails, request a replacement immediately.
trans-unit.target: If a PCM fails, request a replacement immediately.

trans-unit.source: Remove a failed PCM only when you have the replacement and are ready to install it.
trans-unit.target: Remove a failed PCM only when you have the replacement and are ready to install it.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove both PCMs concurrently.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove both PCMs concurrently.

trans-unit.source: The PCM module includes the battery.
trans-unit.target: The PCM module includes the battery.

trans-unit.source: Removing both of the PCMs will result in a no battery-protected shutdown.
trans-unit.target: Removing both of the PCMs will result in a no battery-protected shutdown.

trans-unit.source: Controller modules
trans-unit.target: Controller modules

trans-unit.source: StorSimple devices include redundant, hot-swappable controller modules.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple devices include redundant, hot-swappable controller modules.

trans-unit.source: The controller modules operate in an active/passive manner.
trans-unit.target: The controller modules operate in an active/passive manner.

trans-unit.source: At any given time, one controller module is active and is providing service, while the other controller module is passive.
trans-unit.target: At any given time, one controller module is active and is providing service, while the other controller module is passive.

trans-unit.source: The passive controller module is powered on and becomes operational if the active controller module fails or is removed.
trans-unit.target: The passive controller module is powered on and becomes operational if the active controller module fails or is removed.

trans-unit.source: Each controller module has enough capacity to provide service for the entire chassis.
trans-unit.target: Each controller module has enough capacity to provide service for the entire chassis.

trans-unit.source: Both controller modules must be installed to ensure high availability.
trans-unit.target: Both controller modules must be installed to ensure high availability.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that both controller modules are installed at all times.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that both controller modules are installed at all times.

trans-unit.source: If a controller module fails, request a replacement immediately.
trans-unit.target: If a controller module fails, request a replacement immediately.

trans-unit.source: Remove a failed controller module only when you have the replacement and are ready to install it.
trans-unit.target: Remove a failed controller module only when you have the replacement and are ready to install it.

trans-unit.source: Removing a module for extended periods will affect the airflow and hence the cooling of the system.
trans-unit.target: Removing a module for extended periods will affect the airflow and hence the cooling of the system.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the network connections to both controller modules are identical, and the connected network interfaces have an identical network configuration.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the network connections to both controller modules are identical, and the connected network interfaces have an identical network configuration.

trans-unit.source: If a controller module fails or needs replacement, make sure that the other controller module is in an active state before replacing the failed controller module.
trans-unit.target: If a controller module fails or needs replacement, make sure that the other controller module is in an active state before replacing the failed controller module.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove both controller modules at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove both controller modules at the same time.

trans-unit.source: If a controller failover is in progress, do not shut down the standby controller module or remove it from the chassis.
trans-unit.target: If a controller failover is in progress, do not shut down the standby controller module or remove it from the chassis.

trans-unit.source: After a controller failover, wait at least five minutes before removing either controller module.
trans-unit.target: After a controller failover, wait at least five minutes before removing either controller module.

trans-unit.source: Network interfaces
trans-unit.target: Network interfaces

trans-unit.source: StorSimple device controller modules each have four 1 Gigabit and two 10 Gigabit Ethernet network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple device controller modules each have four 1 Gigabit and two 10 Gigabit Ethernet network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the network connections to both controller modules are identical, and the network interfaces that the controller module interfaces are connected to have an identical network configuration.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the network connections to both controller modules are identical, and the network interfaces that the controller module interfaces are connected to have an identical network configuration.

trans-unit.source: When possible, deploy network connections across different switches to ensure service availability in the event of a network device failure.
trans-unit.target: When possible, deploy network connections across different switches to ensure service availability in the event of a network device failure.

trans-unit.source: When unplugging the only or the last remaining iSCSI-enabled interface (with IPs assigned), disable the interface first and then unplug the cables.
trans-unit.target: When unplugging the only or the last remaining iSCSI-enabled interface (with IPs assigned), disable the interface first and then unplug the cables.

trans-unit.source: If the interface is unplugged first, then it will cause the active controller to fail over to the passive controller.
trans-unit.target: If the interface is unplugged first, then it will cause the active controller to fail over to the passive controller.

trans-unit.source: If the passive controller also has its corresponding interfaces unplugged, then both the controllers will reboot multiple times before settling on one controller.
trans-unit.target: If the passive controller also has its corresponding interfaces unplugged, then both the controllers will reboot multiple times before settling on one controller.

trans-unit.source: Connect at least two DATA interfaces to the network from each controller module.
trans-unit.target: Connect at least two DATA interfaces to the network from each controller module.

trans-unit.source: If you have enabled the two 10 GbE interfaces, deploy those across different switches.
trans-unit.target: If you have enabled the two 10 GbE interfaces, deploy those across different switches.

trans-unit.source: When possible, use MPIO on servers to ensure that the servers can tolerate a link, network, or interface failure.
trans-unit.target: When possible, use MPIO on servers to ensure that the servers can tolerate a link, network, or interface failure.

trans-unit.source: For more information about networking your device for high availability and performance, go to [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md#cable-your-storsimple-8100-device) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md#cable-your-storsimple-8600-device).
trans-unit.target: For more information about networking your device for high availability and performance, go to [Install your StorSimple 8100 device](storsimple-8100-hardware-installation.md#cable-your-storsimple-8100-device) or [Install your StorSimple 8600 device](storsimple-8600-hardware-installation.md#cable-your-storsimple-8600-device).

trans-unit.source: SSDs and HDDs
trans-unit.target: SSDs and HDDs

trans-unit.source: StorSimple devices include solid state disks (SSDs) and hard disk drives (HDDs) that are protected using mirrored spaces, and a hot-spare is provided for the HDDs.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple devices include solid state disks (SSDs) and hard disk drives (HDDs) that are protected using mirrored spaces, and a hot-spare is provided for the HDDs.

trans-unit.source: Use of mirrored spaces ensures that the device is able to tolerate the failure of one or more SSDs or HDDs.
trans-unit.target: Use of mirrored spaces ensures that the device is able to tolerate the failure of one or more SSDs or HDDs.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that all SSD and HDD modules are installed.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that all SSD and HDD modules are installed.

trans-unit.source: If an SSD or HDD fails, request a replacement immediately.
trans-unit.target: If an SSD or HDD fails, request a replacement immediately.

trans-unit.source: If an SSD or HDD fails or requires replacement, make sure that you remove only the SSD or HDD that requires replacement.
trans-unit.target: If an SSD or HDD fails or requires replacement, make sure that you remove only the SSD or HDD that requires replacement.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove more than one SSD or HDD from the system at any point in time.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove more than one SSD or HDD from the system at any point in time.

trans-unit.source: During replacement, monitor the **Hardware Status** in the **Maintenance** page for the drives in the SSDs and HDDs.
trans-unit.target: During replacement, monitor the **Hardware Status** in the **Maintenance** page for the drives in the SSDs and HDDs.

trans-unit.source: A green check status indicates that the disks are healthy or OK, whereas a red exclamation point indicates a failed SSD or HDD.
trans-unit.target: A green check status indicates that the disks are healthy or OK, whereas a red exclamation point indicates a failed SSD or HDD.

trans-unit.source: A failure of 2 or more disks of certain type (HDD, SSD) or consecutive failure within a short time frame may result in system malfunction and potential data loss.
trans-unit.target: A failure of 2 or more disks of certain type (HDD, SSD) or consecutive failure within a short time frame may result in system malfunction and potential data loss.

trans-unit.source: If this occurs, contact technical support for assistance.
trans-unit.target: If this occurs, contact technical support for assistance.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you configure cloud snapshots for all volumes that you need to protect in case of a system failure.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you configure cloud snapshots for all volumes that you need to protect in case of a system failure.

trans-unit.source: EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: StorSimple device model 8600 includes an Extended Bunch of Disks (EBOD) enclosure in addition to the primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: StorSimple device model 8600 includes an Extended Bunch of Disks (EBOD) enclosure in addition to the primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: An EBOD contains EBOD controllers and hard disk drives (HDDs) that are protected using mirrored spaces.
trans-unit.target: An EBOD contains EBOD controllers and hard disk drives (HDDs) that are protected using mirrored spaces.

trans-unit.source: Use of mirrored spaces ensures that the device is able to tolerate the failure of one or more HDDs.
trans-unit.target: Use of mirrored spaces ensures that the device is able to tolerate the failure of one or more HDDs.

trans-unit.source: The EBOD enclosure is connected to the primary enclosure through redundant SAS cables.
trans-unit.target: The EBOD enclosure is connected to the primary enclosure through redundant SAS cables.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that both EBOD enclosure controller modules, both SAS cables, and all the hard disk drives are installed at all times.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that both EBOD enclosure controller modules, both SAS cables, and all the hard disk drives are installed at all times.

trans-unit.source: If an EBOD enclosure controller module or an HDD fails, request a replacement immediately.
trans-unit.target: If an EBOD enclosure controller module or an HDD fails, request a replacement immediately.

trans-unit.source: If an EBOD enclosure controller module fails, make sure that the other controller module is active before you replace the failed module.
trans-unit.target: If an EBOD enclosure controller module fails, make sure that the other controller module is active before you replace the failed module.

trans-unit.source: If an HDD fails or requires replacement, make sure that you remove only the HDD that requires replacement.
trans-unit.target: If an HDD fails or requires replacement, make sure that you remove only the HDD that requires replacement.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove an HDD until there is an indication that the disks and the array are healthy.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove an HDD until there is an indication that the disks and the array are healthy.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove more than one HDD from the system at any point in time.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove more than one HDD from the system at any point in time.

trans-unit.source: During an EBOD controller module or HDD replacement, continuously monitor the status of the relevant component in the StorSimple Manager service by accessing **Maintenance** - **Hardware** status.
trans-unit.target: During an EBOD controller module or HDD replacement, continuously monitor the status of the relevant component in the StorSimple Manager service by accessing **Maintenance** - **Hardware** status.

trans-unit.source: If an SAS cable fails or requires replacement (Microsoft Support should be involved to make such a determination), make sure that you remove only the SAS cable that requires replacement.
trans-unit.target: If an SAS cable fails or requires replacement (Microsoft Support should be involved to make such a determination), make sure that you remove only the SAS cable that requires replacement.

trans-unit.source: Do not concurrently remove both SAS cables from the system at any point in time.
trans-unit.target: Do not concurrently remove both SAS cables from the system at any point in time.

trans-unit.source: High availability requirements for your host computers
trans-unit.target: High availability requirements for your host computers

trans-unit.source: Carefully review these requirements and best practices to ensure the high availability of hosts connected to your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Carefully review these requirements and best practices to ensure the high availability of hosts connected to your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Configure StorSimple with [two-node file server cluster configurations][1].
trans-unit.target: Configure StorSimple with [two-node file server cluster configurations][1].

trans-unit.source: By removing single points of failure and building in redundancy on the host side, the entire solution becomes highly available.
trans-unit.target: By removing single points of failure and building in redundancy on the host side, the entire solution becomes highly available.

trans-unit.source: Use Continuously available (CA) shares available with Windows Server 2012 (SMB 3.0) for high availability during failover of the storage controllers.
trans-unit.target: Use Continuously available (CA) shares available with Windows Server 2012 (SMB 3.0) for high availability during failover of the storage controllers.

trans-unit.source: For additional information for configuring file server clusters and Continuously Available shares with Windows Server 2012, refer to this [video demo](http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/IT-Camps/IT-Camps-On-Demand-Windows-Server-2012/DEMO-Continuously-Available-File-Shares).
trans-unit.target: For additional information for configuring file server clusters and Continuously Available shares with Windows Server 2012, refer to this [video demo](http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/IT-Camps/IT-Camps-On-Demand-Windows-Server-2012/DEMO-Continuously-Available-File-Shares).

trans-unit.source: Networking requirements for your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Networking requirements for your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Your StorSimple device is a locked-down device.
trans-unit.target: Your StorSimple device is a locked-down device.

trans-unit.source: However, ports need to be opened in your firewall to allow for iSCSI, cloud, or management traffic.
trans-unit.target: However, ports need to be opened in your firewall to allow for iSCSI, cloud, or management traffic.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the ports that need to be opened in your firewall.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the ports that need to be opened in your firewall.

trans-unit.source: In this table, *in* or *inbound* refers to the direction from which incoming client requests access your device.
trans-unit.target: In this table, *in* or *inbound* refers to the direction from which incoming client requests access your device.

trans-unit.source: *Out* or *outbound* refers to the direction in which your StorSimple device sends data externally, beyond the deployment: for example, outbound to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: *Out* or *outbound* refers to the direction in which your StorSimple device sends data externally, beyond the deployment: for example, outbound to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Port No.<sup>1,2</sup>
trans-unit.target: Port No.<sup>1,2</sup>

trans-unit.source: In or out
trans-unit.target: In or out

trans-unit.source: Port scope
trans-unit.target: Port scope

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: TCP 80 (HTTP)<sup>3</sup>
trans-unit.target: TCP 80 (HTTP)<sup>3</sup>

trans-unit.source: Out
trans-unit.target: Out

trans-unit.source: WAN
trans-unit.target: WAN

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Outbound port is used for Internet access to retrieve updates.
trans-unit.target: Outbound port is used for Internet access to retrieve updates.

trans-unit.source: The outbound web proxy is user configurable.
trans-unit.target: The outbound web proxy is user configurable.

trans-unit.source: To allow system updates, this port must also be open for the controller fixed IPs.
trans-unit.target: To allow system updates, this port must also be open for the controller fixed IPs.

trans-unit.source: TCP 443 (HTTPS)<sup>3</sup>
trans-unit.target: TCP 443 (HTTPS)<sup>3</sup>

trans-unit.source: Out
trans-unit.target: Out

trans-unit.source: WAN
trans-unit.target: WAN

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Outbound port is used for accessing data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Outbound port is used for accessing data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: The outbound web proxy is user configurable.
trans-unit.target: The outbound web proxy is user configurable.

trans-unit.source: To allow system updates, this port must also be open for the controller fixed IPs.
trans-unit.target: To allow system updates, this port must also be open for the controller fixed IPs.

trans-unit.source: UDP 53 (DNS)
trans-unit.target: UDP 53 (DNS)

trans-unit.source: Out
trans-unit.target: Out

trans-unit.source: WAN
trans-unit.target: WAN

trans-unit.source: In some cases; see notes.
trans-unit.target: In some cases; see notes.

trans-unit.source: This port is required only if you are using an Internet-based DNS server.
trans-unit.target: This port is required only if you are using an Internet-based DNS server.

trans-unit.source: UDP 123 (NTP)
trans-unit.target: UDP 123 (NTP)

trans-unit.source: Out
trans-unit.target: Out

trans-unit.source: WAN
trans-unit.target: WAN

trans-unit.source: In some cases; see notes.
trans-unit.target: In some cases; see notes.

trans-unit.source: This port is required only if you are using an Internet-based NTP server.
trans-unit.target: This port is required only if you are using an Internet-based NTP server.

trans-unit.source: TCP 9354
trans-unit.target: TCP 9354

trans-unit.source: Out
trans-unit.target: Out

trans-unit.source: WAN
trans-unit.target: WAN

trans-unit.source: In some cases; see notes.
trans-unit.target: In some cases; see notes.

trans-unit.source: The outbound port is used by the StorSimple Manager service to communicate with the device.
trans-unit.target: The outbound port is used by the StorSimple Manager service to communicate with the device.

trans-unit.source: This port is required if your current network does not support using HTTP 1.1 to connect to the Internet; for instance if you are using an HTTP 1.0-based proxy server.
trans-unit.target: This port is required if your current network does not support using HTTP 1.1 to connect to the Internet; for instance if you are using an HTTP 1.0-based proxy server.

trans-unit.source: If connecting via a proxy server, refer to [service bus requirements](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee706729.aspx) for detailed information.
trans-unit.target: If connecting via a proxy server, refer to [service bus requirements](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee706729.aspx) for detailed information.

trans-unit.source: 3260 (iSCSI)
trans-unit.target: 3260 (iSCSI)

trans-unit.source: In
trans-unit.target: In

trans-unit.source: LAN
trans-unit.target: LAN

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This port is used to access data over iSCSI.
trans-unit.target: This port is used to access data over iSCSI.

trans-unit.source: In
trans-unit.target: In

trans-unit.target: LAN

trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Inbound port is used by StorSimple Snapshot Manager to communicate with the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Inbound port is used by StorSimple Snapshot Manager to communicate with the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This port is also used when you remotely connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple over HTTP or HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: This port is also used when you remotely connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple over HTTP or HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup> No inbound ports need to be opened on the public Internet.
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup> No inbound ports need to be opened on the public Internet.

trans-unit.source: <sup>2</sup> If multiple ports carry a gateway configuration, the outbound routed traffic order will be determined based on the port routing order described below.
trans-unit.target: <sup>2</sup> If multiple ports carry a gateway configuration, the outbound routed traffic order will be determined based on the port routing order described below.

trans-unit.source: <sup>3</sup> The controller fixed IPs on your StorSimple device must be routable and able to connect to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: <sup>3</sup> The controller fixed IPs on your StorSimple device must be routable and able to connect to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: The fixed IP addresses are used for servicing the updates to the device.
trans-unit.target: The fixed IP addresses are used for servicing the updates to the device.

trans-unit.source: If the device controllers cannot connect to the Internet via the fixed IPs, you will not be able to update your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: If the device controllers cannot connect to the Internet via the fixed IPs, you will not be able to update your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Port routing
trans-unit.target: Port routing

trans-unit.source: Port routing is different depending on the software version running on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Port routing is different depending on the software version running on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: If the device is running a software version earlier that Update 1, such as the GA, 0.1, 0.2, or 0.3 release, then the port routing is decided as follows:
trans-unit.target: If the device is running a software version earlier that Update 1, such as the GA, 0.1, 0.2, or 0.3 release, then the port routing is decided as follows:

trans-unit.source: Last configured 10 GbE network interface > Other 10 GbE network interface > Last configured 1 GbE network interface > Other 1 GbE network interface
trans-unit.target: Last configured 10 GbE network interface > Other 10 GbE network interface > Last configured 1 GbE network interface > Other 1 GbE network interface

trans-unit.source: If the device is running Update 1, then the port routing is decided as follows:
trans-unit.target: If the device is running Update 1, then the port routing is decided as follows:

trans-unit.source: DATA 0 > Last configured 10 GbE network interface > Other 10 GbE network interface > Last configured 1 GbE network interface > Other 1 GbE network interface
trans-unit.target: DATA 0 > Last configured 10 GbE network interface > Other 10 GbE network interface > Last configured 1 GbE network interface > Other 1 GbE network interface

trans-unit.source: In Update 1, the routing metric of DATA 0 is made the lowest; therefore, all the cloud-traffic is routed through DATA 0.
trans-unit.target: In Update 1, the routing metric of DATA 0 is made the lowest; therefore, all the cloud-traffic is routed through DATA 0.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of this if there are more than one cloud-enabled network interfaces on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of this if there are more than one cloud-enabled network interfaces on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Networking best practices
trans-unit.target: Networking best practices

trans-unit.source: In addition to the above networking requirements, for the optimal performance of your StorSimple solution, please adhere to the following best practices:
trans-unit.target: In addition to the above networking requirements, for the optimal performance of your StorSimple solution, please adhere to the following best practices:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your StorSimple device has a dedicated 40 Mbps bandwidth (or more) available at all times.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your StorSimple device has a dedicated 40 Mbps bandwidth (or more) available at all times.

trans-unit.source: This bandwidth should not be shared with any other applications.
trans-unit.target: This bandwidth should not be shared with any other applications.

trans-unit.source: Ensure network connectivity to the Internet is available at all times.
trans-unit.target: Ensure network connectivity to the Internet is available at all times.

trans-unit.source: Sporadic or unreliable Internet connections to the devices, including no Internet connectivity whatsoever, will result in an unsupported configuration.
trans-unit.target: Sporadic or unreliable Internet connections to the devices, including no Internet connectivity whatsoever, will result in an unsupported configuration.

trans-unit.source: Isolate the iSCSI and cloud traffic by having dedicated network interfaces on your device for iSCSI and cloud access.
trans-unit.target: Isolate the iSCSI and cloud traffic by having dedicated network interfaces on your device for iSCSI and cloud access.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see how to [modify network interfaces](storsimple-modify-device-config.md#modify-network-interfaces) on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see how to [modify network interfaces](storsimple-modify-device-config.md#modify-network-interfaces) on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Learn about StorSimple system limits](storsimple-limits.md).

trans-unit.target: [Learn how to deploy your StorSimple solution](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md).
